definition: to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
to bid farewell/tricks of the trade/pithy mnemonic formula (e.g. Mao Zedong's 16-character mantra 十六字訣|十六字诀 on guerrilla warfare)
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in

sentences.english: To me, parting is a painful thing.
Little did I think that we were talking together for the last time.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有想到我們這次談話竟成訣別。

sentences.english: This could be the end, Mark thought.
sentences.chinese: 馬克想，這也許就是訣別。

sentences.english: This was interpreted by all as meaning that he judged the time had come to make his farewells.
sentences.chinese: 所有的人都認爲，這意味着希特勒的訣別的時刻到了。

sentences.english: He could not face a final departure.
sentences.chinese: 他無法面對最後的訣別。

sentences.english: I never thought that was the eternal departure, watching the three-wheel leaving far and far.
sentences.chinese: 看着三輪車遠去，也絕沒有想到那竟是永遠的訣別。

definition: words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
(Buddhism) predestined relationship
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
silent prayer/pray in silence
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
lit. the soul flies away and scatters (idiom)/fig. to be frightened stiff/spooked out of one's mind/terror-stricken
in a pique/sulky/cross
seriously ill and about to die
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
to part forever/eternal parting (i.e. death)
